etymology.interpretation: Meaning is guided by 旨, which signals deliciousness and the idea of tasting or trying flavors. 尚 contributes the pronunciation (cháng) and places it within the 尚 phonetic family.
etymology.simplification: Mainland simplification reduces the complex 嘗 to 尝 by compressing internal strokes and omitting extra elements, while preserving the 尚-like phonetic framework to keep the sound.

examples.chinese: 我想尝一尝这道菜(我想嘗一嘗這道菜)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xiǎng cháng yī cháng zhè dào cài.
examples.english: I want to have a taste of this dish.

examples.chinese: 他从未尝过失败(他從未嘗過失敗)。
请先尝一点，再决定买不买(請先嘗一點，再決定買不買)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng xiān cháng yīdiǎn, zài juédìng mǎi bù mǎi.
examples.english: Please sample a little first, then decide whether to buy.
